sen.j: 源兼行（みなもとのかねゆき、生没年不詳）は、平安時代中期の能書家。
sen.e: "MINAMOTO no Kaneyuki" was a man having good penmanshop in the middle of the Heian period, whose birth & death year is unknown.
"MINAMOTO no Kaneyuki" was a man renowned for his penmanship, during the middle of the Heian period, but whose birth & death year is unknown.

sen.j: 官位は正四位下大和守。
sen.e: He rose to "Shoshiinoge" (Senior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade) & "Yamato no kami" (Governor of Yamato Province).

sen.j: 父は能書家として名声のあった上総介源延幹。
sen.e: His father "MINAMOTO no Enkan" was also famous for having good penmanship, who was appointed as "Kazusa no suke" (Assistant Govenor of Kazusa Province).

sen.j: 陽成源氏で陽成天皇の第六皇子正二位大納言源清蔭の末裔。
sen.e: Kaneyuki was the descendant of "MINAMOTO no Kiyokage"who rose to "Dainagon" (Major Councilor) & "Shonii" (Senior Second Rank), and since Kiyokage was born as the sixth prince of Emperor Yozei, Kiyokage belonged to "Yozei-Genji" (the Minamoto clan whose ancestor was Emperor Yozei).

Kaneyuki was also the descendant of MINAMOTO no Kiyokage who rose to Dainagon (chief councilor of state) and Shonii (Senior Second Rank), and since Kiyokage was born as the sixth prince of Emperor Yozei, Kiyokage belonged to Yozei-Genji (the Minamoto clan whose ancestor was Emperor Yozei).

sen.j: 父、延幹は清蔭の孫とも曾孫ともいう。
sen.e: Kaneyuki's father Enkan is said to have been Kiyokage's grandson, or great-grandson.

sen.j: 当時第一の手書きと称され、位記（位を授ける際に与える文書）や上表文の清書、願文（祈願の意を表す文書）の執筆、色紙形や門に掲げる額の揮毫などを担当した。
sen.e: Kaneyuki was admired as having the best penmanship at that time, so he was in charge of making a clean copy of "Iki" (the document given to a person when a rank was conferred on him) & "Johyobun" (the petition to the Emperor), and also in charge of writing "Ganmon" (the Imperial prayer document for a blessing) & the letters on "Shikishigata" (the colored, square-shaped paper inscribed with verses) & the letters in the frame held at the gate, etc.
sen.cmt: ※「願文（がんもん）」とは、「堂塔建立や造仏に際し、施主（ここでは天皇）が神仏に祈願内容を申し述べる文章」（kotobank.jp 「願文」より）なので、これを踏まえて訳しています。

sen.j: 後冷泉天皇・後三条天皇・白河天皇の3天皇にわたり、大嘗会の悠紀主記屏風の色紙形の揮毫を行っている。
sen.e: Throughout the three-emperor reigns of Goreizei, Gosanjo & Shirakawa, Kaneyuki was in charge of writing the letters on "Shikishigata" of "Yukisuki-no-byobu" (Folding screens used during the "Daijoe" [court banquets held during the first harvest festival "Daijo-sai" after the accession of a new emperor]).

sen.j: 宇治平等院鳳凰堂（阿弥陀堂）の色紙形の執筆やその筆跡から「桂本万葉集」や「高野切」第二種など一連の古筆が兼行の筆によるものとされている。
sen.e: The letters on "Shikishigami" of Uji Byodo-in Temple "Hoo-do" (Phoenix Hall), also called "Amida-do" (Amitabha Buddha Hall), were written by Kaneyuki, and based on the handwriting of these letters, a cluster of ancient writings, such as "Katsura-bon Manyoshu" (Katsura manuscript of "Manyoshu" [the oldest anthology of waka in Japan] & the Second "Koyagire" (Fragment from "Kokin Waka Shu" [the poetry anthology]), are supposed to have been handwritten by Kaneyuki.
sen.cmt: ※1行目から2行目にかけての「・・・の執筆や筆跡から」を「・・・は兼行が執筆したものであり、その筆跡から」の意味にとって訳しています。
